headline: 2025-10-28 — An Australian AI startup was granted 1 AUKUS exemption licence (1 licence) allowing it to share information with U.S. and U.K. defence contractors (evidence: Source 1).

2025-10-27 — ADNOC announced it will apply highly autonomous agentic AI in the energy industry in partnership with 3 named companies (G42, Microsoft, AIQ) (3 partners) at an Abu Dhabi industry event (evidence: Source 2).

2025-10-29 — Business executives and researchers at the Reuters NEXT conference in New York predicted autonomous 'agents' and profitability will dominate the AI agenda for the next 1 year (1 year) (evidence: Source 3).
2025-10-30 — Bloomberg Intelligence published 1 analysis (authored by Mandeep Singh and Robert Biggar) highlighting AI’s shift to inference (1 Bloomberg Intelligence analysis) (evidence: Source 4).

2025-10-30 — Bloomberg ran its UK startups list for the 2nd consecutive year (2 years), signalling continued editorial focus on AI-dominated startup landscape and a rebound in venture capital (evidence: Source 5).

2025-10-31 — Waymo remains described as 'the one to beat' in autonomous driving (1 market leader), and commentary indicates autonomous vehicles will enable more contactless services going forward (evidence: Source 6).
